content: Don't work at lenovo p780. Stops loading at 2/3. FIXXXXED, THANKS
It is nice to finally have android versions of the better board games available.  Also, the AI in this version plays faster on the  nexus 10 than it does on the Xbox version of the game.

I downloaded this to play against my wife who's on an ipad. Worked almost seamlessly. I was a little disappointed we had to do it online not via bluetooth (maybe this feature will be added). My main issue was I couldn't enter anything with the keyboard so we couldn't use the password feature and had to be quick to join the created game before someone else would. Aside from this, we are both fully addicted to playing this and enjoy it more than the board game. A very nice feature is that your 'missions' have the cities highlighted on the map and you can scroll through them and have each separate mission highlight, as well as have them all showing so you can create a long train route.

Saw this app available for Apple devices years ago.  Was disappointed when I had read quite recently that DoW was not going to pursue an Android version.  So needless to say I was floored when I, quite accidentally, came across this on Google Play.  I've not experienced the hang ups others seem to be having.  All games I've played the app has been stable.  The only issue I've encountered is an issue where, after having minimised the keyboard, half the screen remains missing, requiring a reboot.  Several of my friends purchased the game on my suggestion and have experienced the same problem. (Androids)  But as this is just the initial release, I suspect this to be corrected in a future update.   Thank you DoW!  Now if you can just make an app for Shadows Over Camelot, I'll put you in my will.
Great app for playing on the go. Can't fault it.
Sweet!
Thanks for bringing this to my device!
Great
They did perfect with this game.  I'm addicted!  Just with they would include the expansions
Really good game to play, easy to use with additional maps to purchase. Unfortunately I had to uninstall as it was using about 50% of my battery life even in standby.
This game is fun to play and I'm glad that I can play on the go.  One thing I noticed is that the top score name always has "root", and I'm not able to delete it.   Every top score is now Groot.
Tired of Android being inferior. I'll re-rate it when Android gets local play over Bluetooth/wifi and reaches feature parity with iOS. Don't have all the features? Can't get all the stars.

This is a faithful replica of the board game. It's intuitive to use, quick to learn and has gorgeous graphics. There are some minor annoyances, for example; it's a little tricky sometimes to select the route you want (Palermo ferry route on the European map, I'm looking at you) on small screens and even on tablets the opponent popup that comes up when holding over an opponent's portrait is tiny and illegible. But these are minor inconveniences. All told, I've had this game for over a year, and still play it regularly. The online player-vs-player means there's always someone to play who's a challenge, and there are plenty of maps to choose from if you're bored with the basic game and want to pay for more. Money well spent IMHO

You can zoom the main board but not the rest of the ui which is silly. Recommended for beginners and casual players, on a tablet.

This game is very buggy!!! It's the most expensive game I've ever bought and my wife bought it on iOS also so we could play together. First the interface is completely different between the two and hard to figure out how to play together. Also the multi-player game is VERY buggy. About 30% of the time the server disconnects one or the other of us and we can't finish the game which is extremely frustrating. Other times it kicks you out momentarily and you can rejoin but the AI plays for you while your out and screws up your strategy. There are many, many more bugs in the game which are hard to all type out in a review. This is one of the buggiest apps I've ever paid for and it's also one of the most expensive apps I've ever paid for. Please don't waste your money.
replyContent:
The multiplayer online gaming requires a stable Internet connection. Unfortunately if you play with a phone (using the cell data service), the Internet connection can be very bad and you'll experience those disconnections.
Contact us at http://www.daysofwonder.com/en/contact/digital-t2r-android/ with your Google transaction ID for a refund.

This is unacceptable since they now seem tied to my one device even though the game is available everywhere. I strongly recommend not! purchasing this game until the app developers care enough to fix this problem.
replyContent:
The in-app purchases items are handled by Google Play. So they are tied to your Google Play account, not your device. All the app does is ask Google Play to unlock the expansions.
If you have difficulties activating the expansions, check that you are using the right Google account on your device. Restarting Google Play or your device can help too.

I've heard a lot about this game from the tabletop gaming community, saying how accessible it is to play. I think this is an excellent adaptation and plays very well on my mobile device. The text can be a little small to read, but it's not a major issue. The only thing I would change is lowering the prices on the expansions, but overall it's a wonderful game to have.

Overall its worth downloading, but you will find the game becomes predictable quite quickly since computer players actions don't vary enough. It's great they just added pass and play for multiplayer mode with friends!  Suggestions: - randomize the computer algorithms so that they are less predictable. Eg. The Purple computer player always only goes for long segments and doesn't try to compete tickets... this is a good algorithm, but randomize which computer player is given this algorithm to be less predictable. - make algorithms "smarter" to reflect real world strategies.  Eg. The computer never takes short critical segments early in the game... this makes it to easy when playing against computer.  Have it take Atlanta-Nashville, or New Orleans- Houston, etc. when needed for its routes. - add new boards.  Eg. Europe, Switzerland, etc. - add difficulty levels for solo mode. Eg. Easy, normal, expert

TTR is one of my all time favourite board games and I own just about every variation ever published. A family member also has the IOS version on an iPad mini which appears to be a generally better tablet implementation.  The Android version seems generally not quite as smooth or slick in operation, not a big issue to be honest but what I can't understand is why the "play area" (the board) only uses about 75% of the screen estate on the Android version. Even on my 7" Nexus, it's quite hard to see everything clearly whereas on the IOS version, the "play area" uses almost all of the screen.  All in all a great game, good value but translation to Android and overall implementation could definitely be better.

content: Now THIS is the version of Ticket to Ride I've been waiting for. Forget about the funky iOS version, this is a nearly picture perfect port of the Steam/Java client. Full graphics, almost all of the beautiful sounds and lavishes of the larger interface, and all super clear to play. This even has pass & play and support to play against desktop users via the online play area!    However, there is one flaw for veteran TTR players, which is only fixed by the Humble Bundle version . If you have a Days of Wonder/Steam account with TTR maps purchased on them, you are unable to play those maps on the Google Play client, both single player and online. For example, I can join USA games, but not Asia games, despite owning Asia (and all other expansions) on my official Days of Wonder account. But, the Humble client can access this DLC with no issues!  However, the reason why I I have bumped my review up by one star is that DoW is not at fault here. Google Play policies disallow the developer to allow DLC purchased on other platforms to carry into Android.  If you have DLC already, use the Humble client, but otherwise, get a hold of this amazing train ride through the world!

I love TTR, never owned it before though. I really like the app, I can play with AI or my friends and family (haven't tried online yet). I like the music, last move feature is good and it's quick to play - instant setup! The art is very nice and there are no annoying ads! I cannot understand people who complain about the price - I only paid ca. ¬£4.30, in cardboard it would cost over ¬£30! And why would you expect to get another game completely free if you only paid a tiny amount to start with?
And you don't have to worry about stepping on the dropped pieces!

I had all kinds of problems for months with disconnects and null errors when attempting to play.  The issues were so severe that my 100 rated karma dropped into the 60's.  The cause?  I was attempting to play games by choosing 'Play' rather than selecting 'More' and either creating a game or joining a game through that option.  After discovering this option, all the issues went away and the game works perfectly.  The only reason I did not give this a 5 star rating is I had to figure this out on my own.  I reported this problem numerous times and never received even one response from support.

Running this on my Nexus 7 versus my 4th generation iPod Touch has provided an interesting comparison, and two issues that make the Android version inferior.  First is the UI. The Nexus 7's animations aren't nearly as smooth as those in the iPod. Not a big deal. But the layout is also poorly done. For example, when counting points at the end of the game, the UI element at the bottom showing how many route-cards you have, is so small as to be unreadable on a 7 inch screen. It's perfectly readable on my 4-inch iPod.  And more damning is the battery drain. Going into Settings->Battery shows that Ticket to Ride is consuming over 70% of my battery power. I seems like the battery has lost about 80% of it's standy-by life since TTR was installed, but I can't be sure. I am going to do some testing to see if it really is TTR that's causing my battery to last 36 hours, instead of the 10-days that it used to last.

replyContent:
To play together between your Nexus 7 and your iPad, go to the Online mode (the Restaurant). Create a private game (using a password) and ask your wife to join your game on the iPad by going to the Restaurant - the game will be listed in the list of Private Games.

The game play works just fine as you'd expect; it's the standard Ticket to Ride you love on the table.  However the interface is designed SOLELY for tablet-sized screens.  Playing on a phone is not pleasant and there is (inexplicably) no way around that (never mind that the iPhone version works just fine on smaller screens).  The Android version is also incompatible with the iOS version, so you can't play against your friends with iPhones/iPads (either online or via local WiFi/Bluetooth connections).  (This might not be the Android version's fault, since the iPhone version is the one that requires its users to use the Apple Game Center, which is incompatible with Android, but the fact remains that the two versions of the game are very different and won't work together.)  This Android version is also difficult to use in online play; there is no obvious way to create a new game and invite just friends to play.  It also lacks the ability to play a game via a local (WiFi or Bluetooth) connection rather than the internet.  So, it's a fun game, but all the back-end things that make a great app are missing.  Version: 1.6.2-452-2df0a357 Device: Nexus 4 with Android 4.4.2

replyContent: Sorry it does not work for you. Go to http://www.daysofwonder.com/fr/contact/digital/ to ask for a refund. Make sure you indicate your Google Play transaction ID.

content: Now with pass and play!
Love it
I absolutely love T2R.  I have both the boxed game and the app for my Iphone.  As soon as I got a new Android Tablet, this was the first game I downloaded!

This game is more similar to the version available on Stream than the iOS version.  The Pass-n-Play works, but there are graphical glitches when you complete a ticket. If person A completes a ticket, Person B may see the animation behind the "Your Turn" screen. If Person A waits for the animations to finish to prevent this, Person A will be able to see two of Person B's destinations highlighted on the map. Two counteracting glitches.  There area few missing features from iOS that would be nice. Currently no AI is allowed in pass-n-play. Another minor one is that the Android version makes play longer by showing you animations for all of the moves since your last turn. I think this is unnecessary as the icons at the top already give all of the needed info.  It would be nice if the board itself used more of my nexus screen rather than the image of a leather seat on the right  Finally, it is very expensive to get all of the maps ($4.99 Europe, $3.99 Switzerland, $0.99 1910, $3.99 Asia). I am waiting for a sale or a "Map Pack" option to buy.   Reviewed on the Goggle/ASUS Nexus 7.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: The board game was awesome and this has been lovingly translated!
Love it

Frequent crashes. Lower left quadrant very difficult to put trains. If as much attention was placed on the game coding as was put into the in app purchase spam, this would be a better game. It rocks on IPAD. Avoid Android ver. Seen MS DOS games better than this port.
replyContent: Sorry it does not work for you. Go to http://www.daysofwonder.com/fr/contact/digital/ to ask for a refund. Make sure you indicate your Google Play transaction ID.

content: I love this game and the app is awesome. I wish more companies made apps out of thier great board games!
Awesome and fun.  Online feature is another plus.  The expansion packs are also additional to purchase, but worth every penny.  I see this as a once life time purchase.
Easily as good as the board game and love the network options too. The AI could be a little bit better though, very easy to win against computer.
This is the gold standard of taking a great board game and making it a great experience on mobile.
Easy to figure out & true to game. Love the multi player option!
The app won't even start. It has once and it shut down before I could do anything. All it shows is a black screen. I want my money back

content: This is a must buy: excellent adaptation of the boardgame .  The game works very well, no to mention the very good user interface and all sorts of play modalities (solo, pass and play plus online multiplayer). Clearly a quality app.

The pass and play mode is wonderful and it is a great game, but before you sell an app you should make sure all the parts work. It freezes every time I play against computers without the tutorial running.

Bad version of the game. Extremely slow, somehow difficult to see the board (it doesn't take up the full screen).	Coming from iPhone I expected similar, if not enhanced gameplay. This purchase was a big disappointment. The map only occupies a small portion of the screen. Also gameplay is extremely slow...I'm bummed I spent 7 bucks on it.
BUT it frequently flickers and then just gets stuck.  The audio continues on but the video does not.  Also tried to email developer but the address doesn't work.
Has been working wonderful on my TF201.

I bought this for one purpose: to play an asynchronous game with my friends who all have iPhones. My husband and close friends have been playing each other for years and I was really excited to finally get to join. But, they have TTR Pocket which seems to only play other iPhone users. I guess it is my fault for not reading hard enough and assuming iPad and iPhone would run the same program. Since I can't play them and I can't seem to play any asynchronous games period, I will be uninstalling. Wasted $7.

I loved playing the game on my iPhone and disappointed about DOW taking forever about developing the Android app. (1) the app is incredibly expensive, (2) you can't play with friends online across platforms (I.e Apple users). I don't think the interface is as user friendly on Android.
Needs to be fixed or I want my money back!
replyContent:
We are investigating that issue, but until we fix and update the app we can refund if you wish. To get a refund, please send the purchase ID which you received in the purchase confirmation e-mail that Google sent right after your purchase to our customer service : 
http://www.daysofwonder.com/en/contact/digital-t2r-android/#question

content: Love this game!! Thanks for FINALLY making it Android
Does not load pass opening screen on thrive....can't play on duel track if one side already played
replyContent: In 2 and 3 players games, you cannot claim a double route if an opponent already claimed one of the two routes. That's not a bug, that's the way the game is. If you update the app, you'll get an message when that situation occurs, to make things less confusing.

content: I love the game but its pretty expensive for the expansions and regular app. Also there isn't a local feature like that from the apple app store. So I can't play my cousins or siblings who have those devices. We have to create a game online and wade through then others to find the game. Please make a local option... Then I'll give this 5 stars.
Great game! Works flawlessly on my nexus 7, I am able to play my friends on their iPad, and it's a similar experience between the two... Thank you! Can we get small world on android too please?
I cannot click the go button when joining an online game.  Clicking on support gives me a blank screen. I'm not sure if I have to pay more for online play capability.
replyContent: The online games are included. You don't have to pay more for them. Please contact the support to investigate your issue.

content: and the hotseat option is really neat. Just as good as the physical board game . This app is a must have
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added.

content: Glad to see pass and play has been added. Would be nice if you could add ai players to a pass and play game though.
The worked for a long time but now when i play i keep getting Keep getting Alvin errors. At the start of games or in the middle of games hurting my overall score, FAIL
Pass and play is good addition. High score table now saves between sessions. Async play like Words with Friends would be great.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Game play is solid, like the PC version available on steam. Power consumption has been reduced, through it still uses mores battery than I would like.
Would like computer player option for pass and play games. With only 2 people, having a 3rd or 4th computer player would be more fun.
The Apple OS version has more options but I like playing this on my nexus better!
Other than this glitch, I really enjoy the game so far.

I love this game! My family plays it regularly on the Xbox 360. We all have Android tablets and so now we can play it in a different way. It definitely changes the dynamic when you can't tell what destinations people have. The game description was kind of skimpy and I had to take my chances to find out if I could play private online multiplayer games. I can confirm that there is indeed an option to create a private game and I was able to get my family members into the room and play a game. There were a few connection drops for a few of us but the option did come up each time for the player to reconnect so we did get to finish the game. Bluetooth play would be very welcomed as well as a lower price but I am glad to have this game on my Android.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: and the developer responds to issues and concerns. Nice sped up version of the board game. Great for new fans and those well versed in the board game.
replyContent: Please try the latest update. We implemented the most requested Pass-and-play mode and fixed many bugs and issues.

content: I'm so disappointed with this app! I've been waiting for months to get a phone that would allow me to play this game and then I find it won't even let me play with my friends with Apple products! I'm constantly being kicked out of the online play and it keeps deleting my scores! Not to mention the major battery depletion!  I'm upgrading this from 2 stars to 3 as they did add the pass and play which seems to work with no problems. Still waiting to be able to play with my friends with Apple products!
replyContent: Please try the latest update. We implemented the most requested Pass-and-play mode and fixed many bugs and issues.

content: EDIT:  Up to 4 stars.  The last-turn train "bug" wasn't a bug at all, but my inability to count.  I'd still like to see more statistics kept, but very, very playable. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî   There are several pretty aggravating bugs in this game.  If you change the music volume in game, it just stops altogether.  It also force closes and loses my game once every ten or fifteen games.  Most of all, though, sometimes it won't allow me to play trains on the last turn, which recently cost me a LA-MIA destination card, and thereby a win.  This needs to be fixed.
replyContent: In the last turn, make sure you have enough train pawns left in your reserve. It's a common error to miss this. In the last update, the app tells you when you try to claim a route but don't have enough of cards, pawns, right color, etc.

content: Edit - I have downgraded my score because this literally spanks your battery. An hour of gaming and I have 32% left after full recharge, how is this even possible, add these are local games not even multiplayer. I wish it would save you score.  Would love to see play and pass and blue tooth implemented for local multilayer gaming. Apart from that you also have to keep playing for more maps so if you want all maps is going to cost you near ¬£17 for the complete collection which is quite s lot of money imop!

content: Now pass and play option has been added I'm very impressed!
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: The ios version which I loved had a local multiplayer mode that worked over wifi or Bluetooth.  This version cost more and doesn't have that feature.  I only bought it to play with my wife on her iPhone.  Just wasted my money I guess :-(.  Please fix and I'll give 5 stars.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: The game itself is here and fantastic. Well orchestrated, plays beautifully.  The recent updates added the much-needed pass-and-play function and have dramatically improved the usability of the game. The only remaining strike for it is the lack of a phone-friendly interface. It's definitely designed with tablets in mind, and on a small phone screen everything's exceptionally tiny. Hardly unplayable, but much trickier. Still, wonderful game.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Love love love the game but just a few issues some have been expressed by others. 1 it drains my battery even when it's plugged in. 2 resets hall of fame every time you exit the game. 3 needs a pass and play option (which I think it has in the Apple version). 4 I seem to get the same routes a lot, and get given a route that I just discarded, also I have yet to see any routes to Las Vegas? These are things that shouldn't happen from a game that costs so much.     My issues were fixed! Thanks

content: Fantastic game! So glad it finally came to android.
One of the best board games out there, and despite a shaky start, the Android version now does it justice. Well worth playing any day of the week.

it works again!
Perfect interpretation of an amazing board game. The inclusion of Pass n Play has just made this a staple travel game!!

I live this game, so glad it came to android. I wish there were trophies like on the iPhone
I enjoy this adaption a lot and the addition of pass and play gives this app 5 stars.

1080p on a 5" screen is almost to the point of unusable but not quite. I played the steam version so the tiny screen size isn't an issue. In spite of having a pretty powerful phone (Droid DNA), the game is occasionally choppy.   I wish steam (pc) copies came with free android versions or Android versions came with free steam versions. I'm not too thrilled about having to buy it twice.

While the boardgames is genius, the game plays terrible. You get disconnected, there are constant Alvin errors, it freezes, you get a black screen of death, or you get kicked out of all other games because you jumped out of a queue that was missing a player.   Then there's the atrocious behavior by the anonymous players who stall to punish, block your path even if they lose, and always going for the singles to fin it for everyone. No thanks.

This addition has been the most requested and the people's desire has been answered.
Just like board game.
Great to see some serious boardgames implementations for android.  I am hoping that there will be more soon.  Thank you days of wonder!

I really enjoy this app.  They did a great job with it.  Worth the cost.  You won't be disappointed.

Update: Now has Pass and Play, so upgraded review to 5 stars.  Works really well on my TF300 Tablet and my Galaxy S4. UI scales really well for both small and large screen. Looking forward to Small World and perhaps more board games. Criticisms are that there doesn't appear to be a pass and play option. Also it is not immediately obvious how to get into a lobby to set up your own games rather than random online opponents (it's under More... then "Online Games"). Finally a bundle price to buy all the maps at a slight discount would be good. Of these criticisms, only the lack of pass and play is enough to knock it down by 1 star in my opinion. It really is a very good implementation of a great board game.
With the addition of pass and play I have no major complaints with this app.
Worth the money, enjoy playing against people online and plays just like the PC version.

My wife and I love this game. We own the Europe board game map. We play it all the time with our friends too. Will give 5 stars when pass and play update hits  Edit:5 stars for pass and play. Love this fame but this app on android is terrible :(

content: So happy this game finally came to the android market. I enjoy playing it. I would give it 5 stars if  I could play vs. iphone and ipad friends .

content: As *many* others have pointed out, this game is completely useless without pass n' play. That might not be so unusual for a video game, but this is supposed to be an adaptation on a BOARDGAME, for F's sake.

Like
This game really drains your battery. And its kind of slow and lags a lot. May be this was not designed for an android.
Awesome board game.
I've tried to play several times on my phone, but the app always crashes on my 1st move. I have wifi and the phone is on the charger. I basically threw out money since the app doesn't work.

I own the board game version and bought this app to play with friends on long flights and bus rides where passing a tablet around is a lot easier, alas the Android version does not support this mode of play making it completely useless for me...this really isn't hard to fix, just do it already!
No local multiplayer, wtf?!
A lot of bugs on galaxy tab 2. Force closes one out of two games. No response from customer service.
Play very well on the nexus 7, if you love the board game... you cannot love this game as well!!!

True it is stated that the game is formatted best for tablet.  Though my smartphone matches the resolution required in the game's text, with my old eyes I could not read on my smartphone making the game useless for me.  When I asked if I could transfer the game to my daughter's tablet in an email; my email went unanswered.  Great designer, great game, so my review is based on usability and a warning to others who are as excited as I was when the game was ported to android.

A great version of the board game

Good versio of the board game. Really wish had a pass to play option. Like to play with the wife but only have one tablet.

Feels like a sloppy port of ios version. Assets and touch targets are unnecessarily small. Feels like menus are heavily promoting upgrades on already expensive game. Great board game though and more or leas playable, but awkward ui makes is a lot less fun then it could be.

The game itself is great, maybe even more fun than the live board game. BUT this is a SEVERELY crippled version. You can't play against IOS devices (iPhone, ipad). You can't play on a local network or Bluetooth. You can't play "pass and play". So odds are you can't play with the friend who turned you on to the game in the first place! The app is only good for solo play, and playing against other Android devices over the Internet. DoW, if you charge a premium price for an app, offer a full featured product!

I play on my phone and sometimes when I get a call or important text message I have to minimize the app and often times I have to start a whole new game because I lost my progress. I can play against computer players, and against random strangers on the internet, but neither of those things interests me.  I can't play against another person in the same room (by passing the tablet around), and I can't arrange an online game with friends or family elsewhere.  It's pretty much useless to me unless at least one of these modes is introduced.

content: I am glad This game is available for android. Take time to read reviews before you buy. If you want pass and play you will be disappointed. Game is too small for android phone. It is intended for a tablet only.  Online play doesn't allow you to leave and return to the game later... a valued feature of the iOS version which is $2 for a pocket version. This app doesn't add any value not available in the online version...the app is basically Ticket to Ride...Online.

I've been passing on the iPod version. I was really looking forward to the Android version. It's finally out, but needs a lot of work. I want to be able to play with someone else, over a network without having a computer finish if I step away for a minute. I hope this can be fixed soon, or I want my money back.

Loads of fun.  Would love to see a play pass option though.  However if you run out of cards there is no way to reshuffle.   The computer players seem to be able to; you must either be forced in to certain moves you didn't want to take or quit the game.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with sevaral other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Its like the poor man's version of the iPad app but just as expensive.	I just downloaded this as I love the board game and have been jealous of my friends with the iPad and iPhone apps. I was however, extremely disappointed. For 7 dollars there is no pass and play feature, a terrible user interface, and huge battery consumption. How can this app be so bad when the iOS one is so good. I don't think its worth 99 cents much less 6.99.
Great game but it freezes after placing the first trains on the board.
Wonderful game.
It is really great and I like it. But I wish you could play over Bluetooth and also through pass'n'play, like the iPad. Also, it does seem a bit too small and hard to read on a phone.
Doesn't keep track of high scores. Won't let me play on certain titles because it thinks they are filled when they are not. Too many bugs.
replyContent:
In 2 and 3 players games you cannot claim a double route when the other track has already been claimed by an opponent. 
Also, try the latest update. We implemented the most requested Pass-and-play mode and fixed many bugs and issues.

content: The game is good but could be much better.  It needs pass & play and perhaps asynchronous play would be good as well.  For my friends and I to play we need to all have our tablets and be online playing at the same time.  If one of us gets lagged out we are taken over by a bot, typically "dumb bot", and that by itself could potentially ruin your game (and has lost me at least one game).  I hope when Smallworld gets here it will be better.
Fun but needs campaign mode and connectivity with iOS online.   Also needs campaign mode and pass and play, just gets a bit boring only being able to play the computer every time.
replyContent: Please try the latest update. We implemented the most requested Pass-and-play mode.

content: Sometimes clicking on a train card results in a bug, and in the end you don't get the card. The game is unplayable afterwards.
Issue #1: No local play like iPhone or iPad.  Issue #2: It won't save the high scores from game to game. The leader board resets.
No pass and play also it only has one map that is a rip off for $7 and that should have been explained in the description

For a mobile game this is quite expensive, then to find you only get one map,if you want extra maps they are an extra ¬£2.60 each (bar one at 65p) Im sure I got more on the 360 version.  A shame as this is a good game.
Laggy Sucks battery power more then any other app Forced to start with US map. Each addition map is extra.
"Alvin error". Game is WAY too unstable for this much money. Trying to load online games is frustrating and a 50/50 proposition at best, and I have a smooth running Note2.
I had a great time learning different strategies, until inexplicably it just stopped working. Boo! I can bring up the game but no routes, no partnering options.  Epic fail.
Galaxy s4 octa core just gets a black screen

In-program store doesn't load. Screen flashes/jitters instead.  In-game keyboard is screwed. After finishing typing, screen doesn't return to normal. Big black region where keyboard was, and top of game screen cut off. Had to reinstall. Opening game results in similar flashing. Way too expensive for how buggy it is.   Opening menu with same greeting narration also really annoying. Shut up conductor. This isn't my first time playing anymore.

I am supremely happy that Ticket to Ride is now available on the Android market, but disappointed to see that I can't play with friends who are in the same room.  Really hope that a pass and play version will be added soon!  Love that there are several options for expansions and hope that more come!
Works great on my phone, but fails to startup on my tablet.
replyContent: Please try the latest update. It addresses the compatibility issue with the Galaxy Tab 3 10.1

content: Haven't tried online multiplayer yet, but the single player experience is identical to the Steam version for Windows/OSX. Actually loads quicker on my N10 than my Core 2 based HTPC.  Edit: Deducted one star due to the hall of fame list resetting whenever the app is closed. Doesn't affect gameplay, but there's really no excuse for that sort of bug in an app this expensive.
Great implementation of the board game. Pass and play and local networking would be nice. Leaderboard doesn't work at all. Still a great game and a great app.
I always thought this would be a prime candidate for an android app, while I was playing it on my PC. Now it is here and the drive the office seems much shorter...
Lots of fun, nice challenge.

I love this game, but I can't even get through one game! Keeps force closing on me. It wouldn't be so bad if it weren't for the price tag.. What a waste of $7! I can't believe such an expensive game doesn't even work.

I was really excited when I saw this game for Android. I have played the board game and played it on the iPad. I downloaded it for my Toshiba THRiVE tablet to play with friends but sadly every time I try to run the game it freezes. I cannot play it at all. I downloaded it to my phone and it works ok, however there doesn't seem to be a way for two players to play on the same device, which is disappointing. (The apple version of the App allows for multiple players on the same device). I really love this game, and hope to see it improved for Android users soon.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with sevaral other bug fixes and improvements.

content: If you've never played this game, try it - it's a blast, and an easy way to burn 10 minutes. Unfortunately, it's also an easy way to burn through your battery, but the good games always are. What this version is lacking is a pass and play option, but that came later for the Ipad and I expect it here as well. 5 stars when pass and play comes out - 4 until then. Good game.

This game is like a PC game shrunk to fit on a phone. It doesn't work. The large screen area hasn't been taken advantage of, gameplay is crammed up in a corner and there is large amounts of wasted space. Compared to the iPhone version, the android version is slow, choppy, and much less visually appealing. I was expecting good things after playing the iPhone version, and with the price tag I was hoping for much more than I received. Hopefully these guys will pick up their act and create a better quality app.
I keep getting unknown errors everytime I try to start a game now
I wanted to be able to play my friends. Had to dig through the menu a bit, and couldn't find it at first, but now it's going and I'm happy.
Just like the interface on the steam version. Great on my tablet
Constantly getting kicked off the server

I loved this game on my iPhone, and when I found out it has been ported to Android, I immediately bought it. I'm having fun with it, but 2 things: it's a bit laggy and my eyes get strained even after playing only 1 game. I'm playing on my Note 2, and I think there's too much of unnecessary use of the screen. Remove the left unused space, make the board and other things you actually use during a game bigger, similar to its iOS counterpart.
It need the locally option as well as the pass 'n' play
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: This is an expensive game so I have high expectations.  I expect it to be as good as the iOS version but it isn't close.  In particular the buttons are difficult to hit on a phone and it doesn't appear possible to plan against other devices on the LAN.

Very addictive game and the quality is generally good.  Some things that could be improved: reduce the battery drain when the game is running, add hot seat/pass and play mode, add ability to mute the game separate from phone volume, add option to increase AI player turn speed (gets a little slow after you've played for a while with several other AI players), better job of saving single player game state even if app is swapped out or phone is rebooted, reduce price (it's fairly pricey for an app game)
Didn't like this game at all
Spoils the game. The text should auto-scale to the device's resolution. SGN2. 4 stars for developer courtesy.
replyContent: There are issues on some Galaxy 2 models. Sorry about that. Please contact support-android@daysofwonder.com to get a refund.

content: I have played TTR on iOS as well as Android.  I expect to find some differences between the two platforms, but I was astonished to find that achievements and customizable difficulty, which are basic functions on iOS, were both totally missing from this version.  As primarily an offline, solo player, this removes a lot of the fun and challenge for me.  Without these features, it truly pains me but I can't give this more than 3 stars
replyContent: You can play online with the game from day 1. And the Pass-and-Play mode has been added in the last update, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Excellent conversion of the board game! Runs great on note 2, not using a lot of battery and screen size is fine.

This is a great strategy board game gone digital from Days of Wonder.  It seems the developers kind of moshed this one together a little quicker than they should.  They need to do some screen real estate optimizing.  Tiny fonts used on the tutorials make it hard to read on most smaller devices.  It will be nice once they (Days of Wonder) start porting the rest of their games over.
Love the board game, this a great version, on both S4 and N7

Love the game itself but...   Why doesn't this game work with iOS device users? I know the technology exists for droids and Iphones to be able to play each other?  Why only 1 AI level?  Also why no pass and play?  5 stars when resolved
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: The one company that I have been begging for is finally sending their games this way!

This is a fun game, and I enjoy playing it with my wife. Playing a two player game with two devices is pretty easy, and works well. There are a few bugs, though, the main one being that I can't transfer map purchases across devices. I can't even buy the same map on two different devices. I bought one of the maps on my tablet, and now when I try to buy the same map on my phone it crashes.
Only one map for that price?

I love this game.   Have been jealous that my family can play it on their iPhones for so long. Now I can, as well.   The interface is well done. I like the achievements you can work towards in game. I am also glad they allow play on all of the boards.   Great way to decide which I prefer before buying the physical board games! I own two so far.   I haven't tried multilayer yet, but will do so as soon as my family is available to play.
Needs async multiplayer, local pass 'n play, and pause/resume.
replyContent: Please try the latest update. We implemented the most requested Pass-and-play mode and fixed many bugs and issues.

content: This game crashes and drains the battery on my Nexus 7. Progress isn't saved, either. I have to start over every time. I love the board game version, so this is extremely disappointing.
Add pass and play and I will give you 5 stars

I love the game and the app is excellent!  However, in linking my old account to my new account (I have been playing online for ages via PC) I have lost my other maps (which I had paid for).  This was despite being extremely careful as warned by the merging page.  I have emailed DoW support but after almost a week haven't had a reply.  This is my only complaint - everything else is great.  I just miss Europe and Switzerland (but am not willing to repay!)
Love the gameplay and the graphics! Worth the money! Never regret buying this game!!
Online play is really buggy when trying to start a game. Most times it gives me an unknown error.   When it works the game is great.
i love this game
Game is great. On Apple version you can play pass and play style. Please add, no point in the game if you can only play by yourself or online.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Got it to play with others who have this app on ios but ticket to ride does not have local or pass okay mode! Please fix this! Then I will give it 5 stars.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Great strategy game based on the board game.  I hope Days of Wonder ports their other games over to android also.

This is being advertised as an app for Android tablets, but it's installed on my Motorola Atrix 4G (a 2 1/2 year old phone with a four-inch screen) and it has been playing great.    I applaud Days of Wonder for putting the time and effort into producing an Android version of the game and showing some faith that the community will embrace the app.    I have found this to be a delightful, fully functional version of Ticket to Ride, with an interface that seems to work well, even on a rather small screen.
Needs to have pass and play capability. Should work across Mac and Android platforms. Can not save or pause games against the computer.
replyContent: Please try the latest update. We implemented the most requested Pass-and-play mode and fixed many bugs and issues.

content: I've been waiting for an android version for a long time. So happy to finally have this on my tablet. I have yet to experience any bugs on my Nexus 10. Keep improving and I'm happy to give 5 stars

Even though it was made for tablets, it plays well on my HTC One. Very readable and playable. The maps costing extra is a little unfair but might be worth it.   Seems it works on the newer devices with large screens, all else stay away.  For some reason you can't leave the game and come back after a extended leave. Huge oversight.
My dad taught me hoe to play the board game. Then I moved to college and don't play it anymore. Then I discovered the app. Now I play it all the time. Thank you!

Game is great! I have always loved "Ticket to Ride", however this version is crashing as well my iPad and my two daughter's iPods give more options.  Such as being able to choose "Local" opponents over wifi and creating private games on the internet.   I will increase this rating to a 5 star once Days of Wonder adds more playing options as well as fixing the crashing during the middle of games.
replyContent: You can create Private games if you use the lobby (the Restaurant). And the Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Works fine on my Nexus 7. No battery drain issues that I've come across. I would like a two player turn based mode for board game like play without the hassle of having the box on hand.  I'm thinking pub table play here. Add that and it's 5 stars. The expansion packs costing extra I don't really have a problem with because that's the way it is with the physical game too. As long as it's cheaper than the physical media that's fine.

Let me start by saying that the game itself is reasonably fun and well done. My issues are with how the program itself functions.  1) Why can I not play online with friends who have iDevices? that seems monumentally stupid. Other games allow this, so I know the technology exists.  2) Why is it not possible to pause a game? If I am in the middle of a game and then decide to do something else, the game will reset and my game in progress will be lost.  3) It seems, although maybe I haven't found the option yet, that all players in an online game has to be available at the same time. This is unacceptable for a turn-based game. Again, this is not a problem for other turn based games I've tried.  So, in conclusion, I would stay well clear until these things have been fixed.
Couldn't ask for a better port.

I love the game and it works fine on my Tab2 however the game NEEDS A DIFFICULTY SETTING IN THE WOSST WAY! !!!!!  I will gladly make this 5 stars when the difficulty can be adjusted because as it is now its impossible to win agenst the AI! !!  This is frustrating and needs addressed quickly!

The game play is great but the battery use needs to be improved.  I played on my Galaxy tab 2 7" for about 15 minutes while it was plugged in and charging.  When I started the battery was at about 25% and when I finished it was down to 20%.   Can't imagine what the battery use is if it isn't plugged in.    The game play matchs that of the Ipad and is quite smooth but would like a pass to play feature and the ability to login as different Games of Wonder users would be nice to have separate rankings.  If the battery issue is fixed I would probably give it a 4.  Battery is better here are the 4 stars...
Great game, works & looks great on both my nexus 7 and 4
Great game, works fine on my samsung tab 2
Would love to have offline multiplayer
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: The extra maps really aren't worth the price.  Update: The app crashed during purchase of a map. The app doesn't register the purchase, but the charge went through.
I bought all the maps available, and I enjoy them very much.  l would, however, like the option to have more than one human player in the app offline.
The writing was too small on my phone so I couldn't see what I needed to to play the game. It's such a shame as I enjoy playing the board game at home.
replyContent: This version is designed for tablets. It's a bit small on most phones. Please contact support-android@daysofwonder.com to get a refund.

content: Great game. Takes a lot of battery though. But no issues (not one) on my Nexus 7.

Can't see the game board, only the borders (cards and such) are visible or sometimes it happens the other way around. Can't zoom in so don't see the texts. Trying to edit my profile freezes the game and restarts it.
replyContent: There are issues on some Galaxy 2 models. Sorry about that. Please contact support-android@daysofwonder.com to get a refund.

content: This game would definitely benefit most from Pass 'n Play.  Nothing better than passing around a tablet to play a game.  Also, multiplayer over local network would be really nice.  And finally, the ability to challenge a friend to a match would be very useful.

As others have said, the battery drain is incredible, and it seems to hit the CPU even when I have switched away from it.  I've also run into what appear to be game stopping bugs in online multiplayer.
Needs more work

Finally, Ticket to Ride is now available on Android! I have been waiting for quite a while for this. I have enjoyed playing the board game and playing it on the PC online, but now I can play it wherever I go. :-)
I absolutely love the board game but cannot even see the ap to use it.  Every time it starts up it instantly crashes. Extremely disappointed since it is the most I have ever paid for an app!
replyContent:
Please contact us at http://www.daysofwonder.com/en/contact/digital-t2r-android/ with the details about your device. If it does not work for you, we will be happy to refund you.
Yann@DoW

content: Come on days of wonder. This isn't acceptable. I have spent quite a lot on this app!
replyContent:
Could you please contact the technical support : support-android@daysofwonder.com
Please give a description of the steps it takes to crash on your device.

content: my wife and I just purchaced the game to play each other   I am using a Nexus 7 and she a Samsung note.

First off, I'm super happy Ticket to Ride is now at my finger tips.  Want to feed your addiction for passing plastic trains on a board?  Want to build the craziest longest train ever?  Want to go through the Swiss Alps?  Europe?  Now you can on your Android phone or tablet!  Love it!

The game works well on my s3 and by Transformer Prime. But what's up with no pass and play, or local multiplayer? I also I am unable to save my high scores. After every game it records my high score as the only game I have played. Looking forward to updates to remedy the situation.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Well executed and works well on my Note 2, though there doesn't seem to be a way to save a game aside from just leaving the app open. It's also a biy pricy, especcially if you want the expansions.
I've been jealous of my ios using friends who have had this for quite some time.

The iOS version is a lot better. The graphics on this are really laggy and everything is too small. Whats the deal? How could they do such a great job on iOS and such a terrible job on Android? I want my money back.
At last my favourite game on ios (apart from Hay Day) has been ported.  Be nice if we could restore the maps bought on iphone. Excellent job guys, I love this game
I was very disappointed when initially this was only going to be an iOS game.  Thanks so much for bringing it to android!  I love this game!  Hats off to you Days of Wonder!

I have an HTC Thunderbolt, which is admittedly old.  But Play said the game was compatible so I downloaded it.  I've heard a lot about the game and was excited to play it--it's not often I drop 7 bucks on a game for my phone.  The game installed fine and loads.  It looks great and sounds great, but it is slow to the point of being unplayable.  I keep trying, hoping for better luck, and always end up shutting it off without playing a single turn.  Oh well.  I hear the game is great, you should probably get it--just not if you have a Thunderbolt.  Edit: Dev gave refund and the game no longer shows up as compatible with Thunderbolt.  Off to steam to by Ticket to Ride.
replyContent:
David,

We could not test on every device. Since you report that it's too slow to be played, we removed your device from the compatibility list. Please contact support-android@daysfowonder.com to get a refund.

EricB@DoW

content: Good game missing the following options from the ipad version  - Pass and play  - Playing over a Wifi or Bluetooth connection
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: What is the terrible drag lag on cards on the Galaxy Nexus? Any help on this? Hello?

A lot of less than ideal things. Solo games not stored, and doesn't remember your name, etc. Since the ipad version doesn't have these issues, and I must assume someone dropped the ball in the android design.

Good to see this finally on Android, thanks guys. As many others have said, would love Pass to Play option, and there are some bugs to clean up, but it's new, I trust we'll see rapid updates. My bug to mention is when looking at tickets at the end of a game you can't select individual tickets and see the cities highlighted. Still, well worth the cost. I would also like to see achievements introduced, as are present in the iOS version.
Works perfectly on my tablet.
Great app, needs pass and play
Ticket to Ride is a great board game and makes a great app. Can't wait for them to release more of the expansion maps.

It's fun but nowhere near the production quality of the iPhone version. As a wish, I want to hide the extra stuff around the game board when playing. The map is too small by default and too much useless fluff is on the screen.
easy to control, just as pretty as the desktop... but no pass-n-play mode. Of course, people have only been asking for the Android app for years, now....
Works on nexus 4 and galaxy tab 10.1

It's a great game, but on my tablet it's not worth trying to play. Of six games I've started, for have revealed in the game locking up and going into a strobe effect as the screen flashes in time to the music. I can force close, but then trying again I get a few turns in and flash flash flash, I've been wasting my time. Asus FT101
I have the board game, I have it on my Mac, I had it on my girlfriends old iPhone, and now I am so excited that I can get it for Android.
Needs save game and pass and play. That will get 5 stars. Fonts can be a little small on RAZR maxx.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: This is a fantastic game but I am reserving 2 stars until I figure out how to save a game in progress. I hope it is a feature that I simply have not discovered yet..

...at least if you haven't played the game before.  It's awkward and tedious to sign up and to learn the rules,plus it assigns you a login I'D that is just "playerxxxxxx-" (a million numbers).  I spent loads of time attempting to create a login password and name that was personal to me, only to find that 1)I could not do that and 2)then I had to read about 20 links of the rules.  Sticking with other board game adaptations from now on.
replyContent: Hello, to change your Login Name, go to the Station and then to Settings. If you are not logged in yet, tap on the Login button. Once this is done, tap on the "Edit my Profile" button. This will take you to the DoW Web site on your account page, where you can change all you account parameters. Click on "Change my profile" on the left side.

content: I won't criticize the wait, because what matters is that the attitude to Android development has shifted at Days of Wonder.  And that's a very good thing.  The other good thing is everything else about this game.  Easy to play, good UI, and very, very fun.  A very worthy port of a classic and a high recommendation.  Running on: Nexus 7
The iPhone version is great, but for some reason my map does not show up. Hopefully they fix it soon
I didn't know the price came with only the USA map, I thought it had some others... that was disappointing!  But other than thar it is fun :)
Wants more money. Will try and chisel more dollars from you for new maps...

I just got a new Nexus 7. One of the first games I downloaded was ticket to ride. I am on a cross country train trip and I thought this game would be a fun time waster. The intro screens all work, but all of the in game clickable elements (done button, train cards, etc) don't respond. The game is completely unplayable. I tried restarting and changing the settings but nothing worked. A really big bummer.
replyContent: Please contact support-android@daysfowonder.com to get technical support. EricB@DoW

content: This is the second thing we installed when we got our Nexus 10. It looks great and plays well, but the whole point is so we can play together at a restaurant or on the plane. When pass-and-play is included, we'll change our rating to 5 stars.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: As a long time board gamer, I was thrilled to finally see this on Android. Overall, the implementation on my Nexus 7 is great. Solid game play. Never crashes. One minor annoyance is that it doesn't seem to save my high scores after I close the app.  Also missing three features I would like to see: pass and play; the ability to play non-real-time games against specific friends like words with friends; and a single purchase for all maps. Being picky, I think the graphics could be spruced up a bit more.
How do you play between ios and android?
Fun
Plays similar to the Steam version, except on a smaller screen. Would be better if it can save the progress in the middle of a game.
Great fun game that I have been waiting on
Great game, but the wife and I wanted to, play it on our holiday. Shame. Could also do with a confirm or undo button in case of mistakes.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: After jealously watching my wife play this excellent game on her iPhone for months, I now get my chance. It's everything I hoped it would be with a couple of caveats. Local multiplayer (pass and play) would be awesome. It would also be really nice it had the achievements from the iOS version for an additional challenge. I also noticed that the top scores list resets every time I quit the app, but maybe that's because I'm not logged in.
Game is what it is but the add ons and new maps gotta come down in price for this expensive game.

Ticket to Ride, whether you've played the board game or not, is one of the simplest and most fun games you could play. It's often said amongst friends how much easier it's to play on the app than with the board. Additional maps cost more, which I wasn't expecting, and I hope in future it's all just one bundle. But one thing this app is deeply lacking is more local play: PASS-AND-PLAY is seriously needed; when you don't have network access, you'll have to get used to playing exclusively against AI.
Great version

This game has run great on my Nexus 7, with no problems that I can find. Only thing that I am disappointed about is that you have to purchase the other maps separately, I would have rather payed more upfront instead of in game purchases.
Great adaptation of the board game, -1 star for missing pass and play mode!

So the game is awesome, but it constantly resets/reinstalls on my DROID4 (which, yeah, isn't a major device, but come on). Also I'd like to reiterate about the pass and play option: Make it happen, Days of Wonder!
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Excellent game but this version is just too busy, and the icons are almost unusably small (even on a 4 inch Nexus 4) and lacks pass and play. The iPhone version was much better. Why do they have to change it so much?
Needs pass and play! Days of Wonder: if you're gauging how well this does on Android, you need to include pass and play to make it a fair comparison.
Just like the board game. A good multi player option across multiple tablets or network would make it perfect

Love the board game and this is a fair conversion. Sadly most apps of board games can't manage even that, so fair play to the developers. Still not as slick as iOS version, and main negative is AI is a bit weak for experienced players. (Latter will be solved with the option of selecting Vanderbot Jr in later versions I hope.)

Great game that is perfectly ported to android. I play on my samsung galaxy s3 and it plays excellent. Great expansions as well. I hope they offer alvin and dexter, but there is plenty of play now as it is. Thanks gow!
you should probably download this game.

This is a great game! My wife and I were looking for boardgames to play because we were tired of Monopoly, Scrabble, and other extremely commercial games. Unfortunately, "different" games aren't offered locally so we did the next best thing and purchased this game. It's awesome and I can't wait to buy the boardgame to play with others as well. We need more games like this on Android.
Waiting to hear back if I will get a refund! The download took forever & I found it to be a very very boring game
Great port.  How about adding the Nordic map for sale at the store?
Great implementation of the board game finally on Android after years as an iOS exclusive.
Good game. Miss some of the features in the Apple version.

This game is actually quite fun.  Good game play, easy to pick up but still challenging.  There are a few issues: 1) Its hard to tell when the game is going to "end".  The tutorial says when the last cards have been drawn then the game ends, but the gauge that shows how many cards are left still shows about 10% when you on your last turn 2) This is the biggest issue:  they give you 1 map with the (very pricy) purchase.  Want the complete game?  Its double the price.  Yup, double the price get the rest of the maps.    I can see including maybe 3 maps, but including only a single map is just wrong at this price.  Wish I could get my money back on this one, but sadly, only 15 minutes to get a refund from Google play (which was in the middle of the installation process for me).
replyContent: The game ends when a player has 2 or less train cars left in reserve, not train cards.

content: I've been looking forward to an Android version of Ticket To Ride for a long time, and it doesn't disappoint.  TTR is a great game to have on hand for when you have short periods available to play (a solo game lasts between 10 and 20 minutes).  It plays fine on my Galaxy Tab 2 (7").  The interface works very well on a 7" screen (no trying to tap on tiny little routes and getting frustrated), and features like showing you the endpoints when picking route cards make up for the inability to zoom in certain areas. The computer opponents are great for playing solo mode when you're either offline or want to play a leisurely game without being rushed by online partners.  Pass-to-play would be a great addition, and we can only hope that Days of Wonder will include that in a future update.
Awesome game. Hours of fun. Works great on my phone and tablet!
Great
This uses up the battery real quick. Love this game and am glad you're on the Android platform! Can't wait for updates.
replyContent: The Pass-and-Play mode has been added, along with several other bug fixes and improvements.

content: Tried it on my tablet and my phone. On the tablet it's great, plays fast and lots of fun. On the phone the screen in kind of cramped, and the pinch to zoom is annoying because you spend so much time zooming around.  It's missing the hot seat play that I hear is there on iOs. If it gets that I'll probably bump it up to 5 stars.
I Love this game, it's as much fun as playing at a table!!

My biggest complaint is if you get a call or have to use any other app on your phone it closes my game and it is lost. There is no way to continue a game against the computer unless you sit down and play it all at once? I got this game so I could play rounds inbetween doing work... This seems silly & a waste of money if that is true because if I have time to sit down I could play it on steam.  The game runs fine on my device... But I have it and all the expansions for Steam, so it sucks to pay again.
App is new so still quite buggy, but very good game. Once the bugs are fixed will be a five star.
It had a freezing problem, but I shut the tablet off twice and turned it back on twice and it works beautifully now. It's a fun game and worth the money for hours of entertainment.
replyContent:
Could you please contact the technical support : support-android@daysofwonder.com Please give a description of the steps it takes to crash on your device.
Thanks,
EricB@DoW

content: I have not yet been able to play a game yet.  The app will crash before the game can start.   I am using a Lenovo IdeaTab A2107A-F operating Android 4.0.3.     Also, I was quite disappointed see that you only get the USA map for the $7 purchase and that other maps must be purchased. I didn't see in the description that only 1 map was included, but the screenshots made it appear like more would be.   If given the chance, I would not buy again.
Waited a long time for android version of ttr, and it was well worth the wait. Works perfectly on my galaxy tab 2. Days of wonder, you guys are awesome! Thanks for doing this!
A delightful game on any platform!

I am disapointed because I can't play this on my Xoom tablet. It downloaded fine and starts fine, but every time I push the play button it crashes while attempting to load the game board. Hopefully they find a solution soon. I am also out $7. Hoping for a refund. Soo sad...
replyContent:

content: That would be just great if steam purchase of additional maps could be transfered on my android device. But i don't think that it technicaly could be done now. Alas.
Thank you for a great game!
Looks great on HTC One

It works wonderfully on my Asus TF101. the first time I wanted to start a game (on the america map) the screen flickered and froze. Sounds was normal, but the screen itself kept flickering. Shutting down Ticket to Ride and starting up again seems to have fixed it. Seems like a bug somewhere in the start of a game.  I also installed it on my Samsung Galaxys3 Mini. I didn't expect much of it. As expected, when it started up the game, it wasn't nicely fitted to the screen. The center seemed to be in the corner of my screen. So i only saw the top and bottomhalf. Pressing home and reloading the game fixed that, until I pressed play. But again pressing home and restarting fixed that. So I was pleasantly surprised that once ingame (and doing the small trick) I was actually capable of playing the game pretty smoothly.  All in all, 4 stars, I'm sure these early issues will be ironed out quickly. I was considering to give only 3 stars, due to lack of pass to play, but I assume that will be in soon enough.
Great to play ticket to ride on the move, but at almost ¬£5 and then ¬£3.50 for each map its a bit steep. Otherwise 5‚òÖ

A sensational adaptation of the game to the mobile format. And such a brilliant game it is to begin with! One criticism would be that the text and buttons are TINY on a phone, so this game will work better on a tablet. Also, the dialogue and the videos are probably not needed and could reduce the footprint of the game if not included (size is >120mb). Overall: great, fun game that is definitely worth the price.
No hot seat, but excelent multiplayer.
Crashes out to the play store after selecting the USA map.

content: Not a cheap and the extra boards are way too expensive, but it's a good game and works
Great game, great app.
Awesome game!  Smooth!

The game only comes with a single map, each additional map is $3.99 (one map gets boring after a few tries).  Additional game modes (tickets) for the original map are $0.99.  Bottom line if you want everything it will cost you nearly $20 (per person).  I was successful using it on both my Xoom and N7 at the same time (logged in as two different people) and played each other.  I don't think it is worth the price though.

I have the iOS version on my iPod touch and have been eagerly awaiting the Android version so I could play it on my tablet.  I actually prefer the digital version of the game to the board game; there are no cards to shuffle, no trains to knock over, no scorekeeping to fuss with.  But I was really looking forward to having pass and play on a larger device so that I could play it at dinner with friends (much easier to whip out a tablet when you're waiting for food to come) and the lack of this feature is very disappointing, especially since it already exists on other mobile versions.
A great touchscreen translation of what quickly became my favorite board game after learning of it on Geek & Sunday's Tabletop.

Editted: Wow, yeah, I'm an idiot and completely forgot that in a  2 or 3 player game you can't place a train on the second set of double tracks. Guess it's been too long since I played!  Great game, pass and play and making it a little smoother to connect with friends for online play would make it a 5 star experience.
replyContent:
This is one of the core rule of this boardgame: at 2 or 3 players, the double-routes count as one route, which means as soon as one of the player builds a track there, then nobody can builds on the second route anymore.

Brice @ DoW

content: Glad this is finally on the Play store.
TICKET!

I love the tabletop version of this board game as well as the Steam version.  This android app version looks like its just a link into the Steam network version which is fine but I played 1 game on my Samsung Galaxy S3 and it knocked off 10% of my battery.  Plus a couple app crashes.  Three star tops based on the technical issues.  Too much of a battery killer
Hands down, the best board game adaptation on Android! But please add pass n play.

Immediately as Days of Wonder e-mailed me about the publish of TTR for Android, I bought and downloaded the app. I love the pc version (bought through Steam), and I trust the Android version will be equally awesome.
The app is slow to load, slow to run and looses your game sometimes when you task out.
The only thing it is lacking is Pass & Play, which is a very critical thing in my opinion.  Hopefully that update will be on the horizon.  Otherwise, it's perfect.

The board game is excellent, and this app captures the energy of the board game in a portable package. If you've already played, you don't need to use the tutorial: the game is easy to use, and even on a smaller, 7" screen, the touch screen captured what I wanted to do with zero frustration.  I highly recommend this app. So glad it has made its way to Android!
More  digital boardgames!

This is a highly polished port of the great board game Ticket to Ride. It plays very smoothly on the HTC One. If you've played the board-game, this has all the fun of the original, aside from sitting around the table with your friends, wrapped up in a neat and tidy interface. The games also move along much more quickly than the standard table-top version. With this and the recent Small World kickstarter, I'm extremely excited to see Days of Wonder enter the Android market, and I hope this proves to be a worthwhile effort to them... it's something I've been waiting for, for a long time.  While you can play with friends who have the game on iOS or Steam, the  downside is that there is currently no pass and play support; I'm hoping to see that soon!
Quality board game apps are an instant buy for me is about time they started coming to android
Do yourself a favour and buy this game.  The app is smooth and plays really really well even on my phone.  Support these board games so we can finally get more of them for android.

Plays well enough on my Galaxy Nexus and my Transformer TF101. Pass to play would definitely be a plus, as would a reasonably priced bundle deal for all of the maps. Overall though, very happy with it.
I have been wanting this day forever! So happy to see Ticket to Ride on Android. Beautiful on my HTC one x and on my HP touchpad.

game works great on my nexus 4   buy it and show Days of Wonder that it's worthwhile to port all their games to Android!    I would like to see the game use the entire screen(rightmost part where the back and home are, like the youtube app does). We really don't need the scoring chart taking up any room on a phone so put our player info and cards there and stretch the map out as much as possible.

It's VERY well done and runs flawlessly on my Nexus 10. I watched the tutorial (Youtube video on the Play Store) while it downloaded, and there was another in-game tutorial as well that explain the game very well. If you do those and run through one quick singleplayer round (They take 10-15 minutes tops in my experience), you'll be just fine.  The main menus are laid out well and its easy to find your way around both them, and the in-game menus.  Multiplayer works well, but it is online only. There's no pass and play and no Google Games integration. You CAN play with PC and iOS gamers, though (I'd like to note that iOS gamers have Game Center integration. Hopefully Google Games is coming soon!)  One thing I'd like to note is that my Nexus 10 heated up more than it EVER has before and this game exhausted my battery very quickly. I've never seen it get that hot before or drain that fast. About 2 hours took it from 50% to 0. Luckily, it died right after a round ended. Not quite sure why it's so demanding to run this game.  Overall, I'm gonna say it's about a 4.5 out of 5. I'd like to see pass-and-play and Google Games integration, then I'll give it a 5!
I have a large phone, Nexus 4. And this is too small to see some things.  The game itself is fantastic, but the map cards and seeing what's left is hard to manage...
Only missing a fifth star due to lack of pass and play.  Needed for long road trips and dinning out.
Would be happier with this app if my Steam purchases carried over.
Won't download to my blaze. Attempted for hours, missed app return window. That transaction could have gone better. Suggest waiting until compatibility issues are worked out

content: Great game. Now just need small world to come over.
A great version of a great game. Plays very smooth thus far on my nexus 7 and on my Galaxy nexus.
Pass-and-play would be nice.
Brilliant implementation and plays great on my Nexus 7! Let's hope we see many more board games coming to Android soon.
Finaly after iphone game
So glad to have this on android! Game plays great on my gs3 running CM 10.1 and on my nexus 7. Game play is perfect
Been waiting forever, finally here, and It's great....  Hope this means Small World is on the way...
Great on all modern Android devices. A great version of the best tabletop there is. Many thanks for bringing to Android.

I've been playing it on my Nexus 10, and it's pretty good. There are a few instances during the final scoring that the game stutters, but nothing crashes. The map zooming and panning does some odd things, but it's functionable.  I really miss the ticket being clipped, and the clip noise that's played on the iPad. Not sure way that was removed. I also miss the error sound from a missed ticket during the final scoring. I even wish it would cause a vibration to drive home the point.  Other than that, it plays just fine. Thanks so much Days Of Wonder for bringing this to Android. I don't even mind buying it again, in hopes this funds more games!

I love Ticket to Ride. I play it constantly on my iPad, but unfortunately, as another user said, the game is really choppy/laggy on even slightly older hardware. I'm running a Verizon Galaxy Nexus and there's a noticeable lag with interactions and some animations.  Also, a $2 "pocket edition" would have been nice since that exists in the iOS world. $7 for a phone only game is just a tad spendy.  As another reviewer pointed out, it would also be nice to be able to share map purchases previously made in iOS version on this new version. Maybe have some sort of account with Days of Wonder that links all of your purchases together?  I look forward to getting a new phone this summer that will be more capable of playing this game. I'm also looking forward to DoW's Small World android app.

Update: The first time I installed this I just got a black screen when I tried to play.  After uninstalling and reinstalling the app, it works fine.  Works great, and I'm super excited to finally have this available on Android.
replyContent: Great news! We were wondering what was wrong with the device, which is normally powerful enough to run the app. Have fun! -Yann @ DoW

content: More like this please

Ticket To Ride is a great board game which translates perfectly to a touchscreen environment. After far too long Days of Wonder have ported it to Android but it was worth the wait. If you like board games at all, give this a try.

I have an EVO 4G, released in 2010, and definitely getting long in the tooth.  It's running the latest Jellybean, but Ticket to Ride is too much for it.  TtR installs, runs, looks and sounds gorgeous, but is unplayably slow.  For most interactions there's a second or two lag between when you tap the screen and when the game reacts to you.  TtR isn't a twitch game, but it's bad enough that even hardcore TtR fans probably won't be able to stand it.  I hate to say it, but Days of Wonder should consider restricting the game to newer devices if they can't put significant time into speeding it up.
replyContent: Hello Rick, sorry to hear about your difficulties. Normally the EVO 4G is not part of the compatibility list, the device is not fast enough and does not have enough RAM. So we wonder how you were able to install it. We are investigating. -Yann @ DoW

content: Now I get to sink more time into this game than any human should.
Finally!!!  I have been waiting for this for such a long time!
I bought this the instant I saw it was available. Hope to see DoW bring other games to the Android platform. This is a wonderful game with a very intuitive interface.
Just as good an implementation as it was on the iPad.  Looking forward to plenty of games in the future.
